overview.title: Warrant Officer Application Process
overview.description: The WO program selects technically proficient enlisted Marines for commissioning. The process typically takes 6-12 months from start to board results.

phases.name: Eligibility Verification
phases.description: Confirm you meet basic eligibility requirements before investing time in the package.

tasks.details: Verify TIS (8-22 yrs), TIG, GT score (110+), PFT (1st class), conduct record

tasks.task: Check current MARADMIN for board dates
tasks.details: MARADMINs are released in January each year with specific deadlines
Review NAVMC 1200.1 MOS Manual for WO MOSs in your field
Career planners can verify eligibility and provide guidance

phases.name: Medical Processing
phases.description: Complete commissioning physical. This is often the longest lead-time item.

tasks.details: Contact medical to schedule. May require referral to MEPS or larger facility.
Medical history - be thorough and honest. Gather supporting records.
Includes vision, hearing, bloodwork, urinalysis
Must be within 3 years of board date
Work with medical to prepare waiver packages for any conditions

tips: Start this phase first - medical waivers can take months
Keep copies of all medical documentation

phases.name: Records Verification
phases.description: Gather and verify all personnel records are accurate and up to date.

tasks.details: Verify all service information is accurate
Verify all PME, MCI, college credits are posted
Verify all awards are posted. Submit corrections if needed.
Official MCTFS print only. Verify GT/EL scores meet requirements.
Ensure clearance is current and eligible for required level

tips: Submit corrections through S-1 immediately - can take weeks

phases.name: Application Preparation
phases.description: Prepare the application letter and supporting documents.

tasks.details: 100-500 word essay. Address motivation, experience, leadership.

tasks.task: Review sample application from MCRC website
tasks.details: Follow exact format. Reference sample for structure.
Work with S-1 to complete all sections
Clear photos of all body markings per MCO 1020.34H
Prepare documentation for any required waivers

letterFormat.subj: APPLICATION FOR THE WARRANT OFFICER PROGRAM

phases.name: Command Endorsement
phases.description: Route package through chain of command for endorsements.

tasks.details: Required interview with Commanding Officer
First endorsement with recommendation
Intermediate endorsement
Required for all applications

tips: Brief each endorser on your qualifications
Provide them your package early for review

tasks.details: Organize in order specified by MARADMIN
Keep complete copy for your records
Email to warrantofficerboard@marines.usmc.mil via DoD SAFE
Contact MCRC to confirm package received

commonMistakes: Starting medical too late - begin immediately
Not verifying records accuracy - check everything
Not following exact format from sample application
Submitting after deadline - no extensions granted

overview.title: Recruiting Duty Screening Process
overview.description: Special Duty Assignment to Marine Corps Recruiting Command. 36-month tour at a Recruiting Station.

phases.name: Volunteer and Eligibility
phases.description: Express interest and verify eligibility for recruiting duty.

tasks.details: Written statement to command expressing interest
TIG/TIS, conduct, fitness requirements
Discuss timing and HQMC selection process
Command screening interview documentation
Initiated by S-1 through HQMC

tasks.task: Obtain credit check authorization and report
tasks.details: Recruiting duty requires financial screening
From state DMV, within 30 days
BIR, awards, PFT/CFT, height/weight
Within 2 years, DD 2808 or equivalent
Must be Class 1 or 2
Service uniform, within 6 months
Verify emergency data and insurance
Via chain of command to Recruiting District
Selection teams meet periodically
Upon selection, orders to Recruiters School

keyRequirements.conduct: No NJP within 24 months, no courts-martial

generalTips: Start early - most packages take 3-6 months to complete properly
Keep copies of everything - packages get lost
Track your routing - follow up regularly
Be honest on all forms - discrepancies are disqualifying
Use the checklist - missing items delay processing
Get endorser buy-in early - they need time to write meaningful endorsements
